title: Domain 3.4: Given a scenario, install and configure motherboards, CPUs, and add-on cards.
content:
üß© Motherboard Form Factors

ATX

Standard desktop board with lots of room for upgrades.

üß† Tip: Ideal for max expansion.

ITX

Mini boards for compact builds. Limited ports and slots.

üß† Tip: Great for small form-factor PCs.

üîå Motherboard Connector Types

  • PCI: Legacy expansion slot
  • PCIe: Modern slot for GPUs, SSDs, NICs (x1‚Äìx16)
  • 24-pin/8-pin: Power connectors
  • SATA/eSATA: Storage connectors (internal/external)
  • Headers: USB, audio, front panel connections
  • M.2: Slot for SSDs/Wi-Fi (check compatibility!)

üß© Motherboard Compatibility

  • CPU Sockets: Must match CPU type (Intel LGA / AMD AM4/AM5)
  • Server Boards: ECC RAM, RAID, multisocket
  • Multisocket: For dual-CPU servers/workstations

‚öôÔ∏è BIOS/UEFI Settings

  • Boot Options: Select boot device
  • USB Permissions: Enable/disable USB ports
  • TPM: Hardware security for BitLocker, Windows 11
  • Fan Settings: Adjust fan speed profiles
  • Secure Boot: Only allows trusted OS to boot
  • Boot Password: Adds BIOS security

üîê Encryption

  • TPM: Built-in security chip (BitLocker, Secure Boot)
  • HSM: Hardware crypto processor (banks/data centers)

üß† CPU Architecture

  • x86: 32-bit (legacy)
  • x64: 64-bit (modern)
  • ARM: Mobile-friendly, low power

üß† CPU Features

  • Single-Core: One task at a time (rare today)
  • Multicore: Parallel processing with multiple cores
  • Multithreading: 1 core handles 2 threads (SMT/Hyper-Threading)
  • Virtualization: Required for VMs (Intel VT-x / AMD-V)

üß© Expansion Cards

  • Sound Card: Better audio for music/studios
  • GPU: Graphics, gaming, editing (PCIe x16)
  • Capture Card: Video recording/streaming input
  • NIC: Adds network ports/speeds

üå¨Ô∏è Cooling

  • Fans: Moves air (intake/exhaust)
  • Heat Sink: Draws heat away from CPU/GPU
  • Thermal Paste: Improves heat transfer
  • Liquid Cooling: Efficient, quiet cooling loop
